text.text_translated: More questions are being asked about how genes influence brain and language development. For example, people want to know if gene mutations gave us the ability to speak. Researchers have found a gene mutation, which is a change in a gene, that occurred between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago and seems to be connected to how we speak and how our brains control our mouths and faces. Monkeys have a similar gene, but it did not undergo this mutation. It is too early to say how much genes influence language, but one day, the answers might be found in our DNA.
